main event: On April 25, 1957, a civilian observed a large, red, crescent-shaped object descending slowly from the sky in Ringgold, Louisiana, which remained visible for approximately 25 minutes. The sighting was classified as a ground-visual observation, and the report concluded the object was UNIDENTIFIED.
interesting points: The object was described as large as 4 or 5 moon houses and covered 12 or 15 trees, appearing as bright red and metallic.
It hung in the sky like a cradle and did not change its position during descent.

The object made a steady but slow descent at about a sixty-degree angle from the south toward the west of the observer, disappearing while the observer was attempting to summon residents of a nearby house.
The sighting lasted for approximately 25 minutes in the dark of the night, with no discernible sound associated with the object.
It was reported that a detailed search on foot was not considered practicable in the rugged and remote area where the object was said to have landed.
